result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert Leory Myers Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Restitution ordered: $5231.64 - Selective Insurance Co.  Court orders restitution converted to civil judgment.

Defendant to pay court costs and DNA surcharge.  Defendant to pay court appointed attorney fees.  Costs, surcharge, and fees to be added to current payment plan.  If not paid, one day in jail for each $50.00 of unpaid fines.  5/15/17:  Court approves court appointed attorney's fees in the amount of $1,881.37.
Defendant to submit DNA sample and fingerprints.

Def wishes to enter plea to count 1, defense files plea questionnaire.  Court advises rights, court finds defendant KVI waives rights and accepts plea.
